channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: CCPD Announces Western Digital HDD Teardown Workshop
item.description: Scheduled from 4:00PM to 5:00PM on September 24 in the Rensselaer Union’s Shelnutt Gallery, this hands-on workshop related to data storage gives students the opportunity to learn about the cloud, including the various types of storage devices and the considerations that are most important for the cloud. Participants will also disassemble an actual hard-drive and discuss the engineering behind it. Space is limited to 25, so register today!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Just In Time” Career Fair Prep with Western Digital to be Held September 25
item.description: It’s the week of the Career Fair, so if you need some last-minute prep, this is the workshop for you! Just attend this session in the CCPD conference room from 3:00PM to 4:00PM on Wednesday, September 25 to learn how to prepare your resume, deliver an elevator pitch, talk with employers, use the platform, and more!
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of Rensselaer’s Fifth Service Day on October 5!
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 5, 2024 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM - RPI Service Day is an event open to all students to give them a chance to spend a few hours helping the community at various local organizations! Alpha Phi Omega, Rensselaer’s co-ed service fraternity, is working closely with the Bicentennial committee to elevate this event and allow all interested students to learn about and help the local community. Free transportation and lunch will be provided.
item.author: Students

item.title: First Game Jam of the Year Starting September 20
item.description: RPI’s Game Dev Club is hosting its first Game Jam of the year starting on Friday, September 20 at 5pm in Sage 2411! Kick off the fall and join us once again (or for the first time!) for a 48-hour jam, with overnight breaks beginning at 10:00 PM both Friday and Saturday nights and doors opening again at 8:00 AM each morning. Teams will be formed to design your own game from scratch. Students of all years, areas of study, and experience levels are welcome to participate!
item.author: Students

item.title: Planning to Graduate This December?
item.description: If you plan to graduate in December 2024 and haven’t completed your degree application yet, the Student Information System (SIS) is now open to apply! The application deadline is Friday, October 11. Please make sure you refer to the Registrar’s Graduation & Commencement webpage for complete details!
item.author: Students

item.title: OGE to Hold Co-Terminal Program Information Session
item.description: Date: Monday, September 23, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - The Office of Graduate Education invites students interested in learning about the application process and the great opportunities the Co-Terminal Program provides to attend this session! Please contact Steven Atkinson if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: EMPAC Fall Building Tours to Begin September 28
item.description: Each of EMPAC’s tours takes visitors behind the scenes to experience the center’s infrastructure as few do, so plan to join Associate Director Jonas Braasch for a free public tour of the building at 1:00PM on Saturday, September 28. Each tour is hosted by an EMPAC staff member with a different area of expertise, so there’s always something new to learn and discover! Tours begin in the main lobby and run approximately 90 minutes; please arrive 15 minutes before tour time.
item.author: Community

item.title: Session to Review Certificates in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI
item.description: Date: Friday, September 27, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for a session highlighting Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI. Attendees can expect to learn how data can inform better decisions, and will review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand. Please register to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Be a Part of the Annual “Run to Remember” 5K!
item.description: Date: Saturday, September 28, 2024 7:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Brought to the Troy community by RPI AFROTC Detachment 550, this family-friendly, community-wide event is aimed at supporting local veterans as well as current college students. With RPI celebrating its 200th year, we hope the Bicentennial will bring the community together to enjoy this outstanding event. 60% of the event profits made will be donated to the Special Operations Warrior Foundation.
item.author: Community

item.title: LGBTQ+ Task Force Meeting Slated for September 24
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 24, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The LGBTQ+ Task Force is a group of faculty, staff, and students working to improve the climate for the LGBTQ+ community at RPI. If you’re interested in joining the Task Force, please come to the group’s first meeting of the year! If you can’t attend the meeting but would still like to participate, please contact the Task Force.
item.author: Community

item.title: NSF Leader Explores RPI Research and Workforce Development Initiatives During Visit
item.description: Rensselaer recently welcomed Susan Margulies, Ph.D., leader of the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) Directorate for Engineering to learn about RPI research and education capabilities, participate in a panel discussion, and give a presentation on NSF programs and opportunities to RPI community members and representatives from the University at Albany, Siena College, and Union College.
item.author: Community

item.title: Math Colloquium Slated for September 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - This Mathematical Sciences Colloquium will feature a presentation titled “Direct interpolative construction of quantized tensor trains” by speaker Michael Lindsey from UC Berkeley.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Perspectives from Palestine” Event to be Held September 24
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 24, 2024 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM - Hosted by Rensselaer Voices for Palestine, this event features Keren Carmeli, an Israeli-American and member of the Albany chapter of Jewish Voices for Peace, and Faris Amer, a Palestinian-American pharmaceutical professional at Regeneron and active member in the Capital Region’s Muslim community. Come for a chance to hear first-person perspectives from individuals who grew up in the region, as well as for a Q&A session.
item.author: Community

item.title: Fidelity Holding In-Person Confidential Retirement Consultation Sessions October 3
item.description:
Date: Thursday, October 3, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - Schedule a confidential consultation to help you become better informed and more confident about your workplace retirement savings plan benefits!
